info.title: Platform Workshop
info.description: This collection contains requests and stored responses you can use when preparing for a Platform workshop.

post.summary: Forms Authentication with Token include HostID

get.description: The response contains the organization the user is currently logged in.
The response contains all file cabinets AND baskets the current user has access to.
get.summary: Get all file cabinets and baskets

get.description: You can use "self" relation for each resource in order to get all data related to it.
get.summary: Get all data for a file cabinet (e.g fields)
Check-in a particular document from file system

post.description:
**IMPORTANT:** Version management has to be activated for the file cabinet you are using.

The response contains the generated file name in the header "*Content-Disposition*"

E.g.: Content-Disposition  attachment; filename=18+41537414-0df0-4d08-adb5-fa40564b80f9+EmploymentContractWithBarcodeOnBothP.pdf

**IMPORTANT:** You have to use this file name if stored the document to the file system!
post.summary: Check-out a particular document and download it
tags: Check-out a document to the file system

get.description:
The response contains the thumbnail that represents the first page of the document.   
The document is specified in request using it's doc id.  
Additionally you can specify section and page number (see request parameters).
Download document that is specified using it's doc id in the request.
The response contains a list of documents stored in a file cabinet or basket specified in the request by it's id.
get.summary: Get documents from a file cabinet

post.description:
This request send a POST to the "documents" link of a target file cabinet in order to create a database entry of a new document.  
This request also contains body with a JSON object specifying index values.  

The response contains a document created.

The next step is to use the "sections" link to POST a document that should be uploaded.
post.summary: Create a new document in a file cabinet
tags: Upload a new document and index it

get.description: The response contains a particular document specified in request using it's doc id.

The response contains all dialogs that belong to the file cabinet specified in the request.  

The next step is to follow "self" link of search dialog you want to use for building search query.  
("Type": "Search")
get.summary: Get all dialogs of the file cabinet

get.description:
The response contains data related to the search dialog specified in the request.

The next step is to use "dialogExpression" link for a POST request in order to build the search query.

post.description:
This request contains a body with JSON object that specify your search criteria.  
The response will contain the URL you can use for a GET request which will perform the serach according to criteria you've specified by the JSON object.
post.summary: Build the URL to use in GET request
tags: Search for documents / build and use document queries

put.description: The response contains all index values of the document.
tags: Update index values of a document
Upload a new document and index it

parameters.name: p
parameters.description: SRLV (search dialog, result list and viewer), RLV (result list and viewer) ,  V (Viewer) , D (Download)

Fields.Item: Roller coaster in the leisure park
